description: I think that this is a risky move to use the Convelescent Serum method to treat patients with Ebola because we could end up infecting people with a disease, but I do think there are possible ways to get around that as well. One of them being testing the blood before making a transfussion. Although it will take a little extra time in the lab, it could end up saving many lives. Unfortunately right now there aren't many things that are working to help these patients, and I think if we can think of a cost effective and effecient way to make these blood transfussions work it will be very successful.
summary: This disease is responsible for killing thousands of people. It is not a new disease either, Ebola was first documented about 40 years ago. Taking blood from Ebola survivors and donating it to those who are currently fighting the disease could be very beneficial. This could be helpful because the Ebola survivor's immune system has developed antibodies which will help fight the virus. However, there are some risks involved with this procedure such as the spread of HIV or hepatitis C from the blood transfusions. In my opinion, despite the risks involved, we should continue to investigate the possible outcomes on the Convalescent Serum.
title: Treating Ebola infected people with survivors blood
